    Get BOM daily précis forecast for select towns from BOM

    get_precis_forecast.Rd

    Fetch the BOM daily précis forecast and return a data frame of the seven-day town forecasts for a specified state or territory. Ported from bomrang.

    get_precis_forecast(state = "AUS")

    Arguments

    state

    Australian state or territory as full name or postal code. Fuzzy string matching via base::agrep() is done. Defaults to “AUS” returning all state bulletins, see Details for more.

    Value

    A data.table::data.table() of an Australia BOM précis seven day forecasts for BOM selected towns.

    Details

    Allowed state and territory postal codes, only one state per request or all using AUS.

    ACT

    Australian Capital Territory (will return NSW)

    NSW

    New South Wales

    NT

    Northern Territory

    QLD

    Queensland

    SA

    South Australia

    TAS

    Tasmania

    VIC

    Victoria

    WA

    Western Australia

    AUS

    Australia, returns forecast for all states, NT and ACT

    References

    Forecast data come from Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) Weather Data Services
    http://www.bom.gov.au/catalogue/data-feeds.shtml

    Location data and other metadata for towns come from the BOM anonymous FTP server with spatial data
    ftp://ftp.bom.gov.au/anon/home/adfd/spatial/, specifically the DBF file portion of a shapefile,
    ftp://ftp.bom.gov.au/anon/home/adfd/spatial/IDM00013.dbf

    See also

    parse_precis_forecast

    Other bomrang-ported: find_forecast_towns(), get_ag_bulletin(), get_available_imagery(), get_available_radar(), get_coastal_forecast(), get_satellite_imagery(), parse_coastal_forecast(), parse_precis_forecast(), update_ag_station_locations(), update_forecast_towns()

    Author

    Adam H. Sparks, adamhsparks@dpird.wa.gov.au and Keith Pembleton, keith.pembleton@usq.edu.au and Paul Melloy, paul@melloy.com.au

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # interactive()

# get the short forecast for Western Australia
get_precis_forecast(state = "WA")
}

    Contents

    Developed by Rodrigo Pires, Anna Hepworth, Rebecca O’Leary, Jonathan Carroll, James Goldie, Dean Marchiori, Paul Melloy, Mark Padgham, Hugh Parsonage, Keith Pembleton, Adam H. Sparks.
